description: Colchester City Council approves its share of tax on residents, whereas Harlow Council freezes it.
title: Colchester council increases tax by 2.99% and approves budget
title_page: Colchester council increases tax by 2.99% and approves budget - BBC News
maintext:
Another council in Essex has agreed to increase its share of tax on residents by the maximum amount of 2.99%.
Members at Colchester City Council approved a budget for 2025-2026, external at a meeting on Wednesday.
Essex County Council, Southend, Braintree, Basildon and Tendring are among the local authorities in the county that have already agreed tax increases.
The Liberal Democrat deputy leader at Colchester, Mark Cory, said his teams faced "pressures of rising costs and demand".
